page.title: 01Typical Rural Wiltshire
page.content: This area holds three small villages, all in the valley of the River Wylye. The surrounding countryside is mainly agricultural; in the valley almost entirely grazing pasture for cattle and sheep. The Bristol-Southampton railway runs through the valley, as does A36 main road (Salisbury-Bath). To the north and south the land is undulating downland, mainly agricultural with some natural deciduous woods. The area is designated an area of outstanding natural beauty and contains conservation areas. The population is very mixed, some retired, some agricultural, some employed in nearby towns such as Salisbury, Bath, Warminster. Also a few weekenders.
